headline: Why Coinbase (COIN) Stock Is Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of blockchain infrastructure company Coinbase (NASDAQ:COIN) fell 5.4% in the afternoon session after the company announced a plan to offer $2 billion in convertible senior notes. The private offering consisted of two $1 billion tranches, due in 2029 and 2032, directed at qualified institutional buyers. Investors reacted to the potential for future dilution. Dilution happens when a company issues new shares, which can decrease the ownership percentage of existing stockholders. The news ext

headline: Coinbase Dives On Massive Debt Offering News After Crashing On Earnings – Is Coinbase Stock A Sell Now?
summary: Coinbase sank Tuesday after the cryptocurrency exchange said it plans to make a private offering of $2 billion in convertible senior notes.  Shares rallied to their all-time high of 444.65 after the House passed the Genius Act and President Donald Trump signed it into law on July 18.  The law establishes a regulatory framework for digital coins pegged to the U.S. dollar.

headline: Coinbase Stock Is Falling After $2 Billion Debt Offering
summary: Shares of  Coinbase Global  were slumping Tuesday after the cryptocurrency exchange announced a convertible note offering worth up to $2.3 billion.  Coinbase  also expects to grant options to purchase up to an additional $150 million of each set of notes.  Coinbase stock was falling 5.4% on Tuesday.

headline: Coinbase, Circle, Metaplanet Stocks Tumble: What's Driving The Decline?
summary: A wave of sharp drawdowns across crypto-exposed equities like Coinbase (NASDAQ:COIN), Circle (NYSE:CRCL), and Metaplanet (OTC:MTPLF) is pointing to a broad market rejection of inflated valuations. What Happened: The declines, driven less by macro headwinds and more by overpayment for narrative-driven exposure, are triggering a necessary reset in how investors price crypto's equity proxies, according to 10x Research. headline: Engine Surpasses 1,000 Employees, Adds Senior Finance and People Leaders to Accelerate Growth
summary: DENVER, August 05, 2025--Engine, the modern platform reshaping business and group travel, today announced it has surpassed 1,000 employees – up from 700 at the start of 2024. This milestone reflects not only rising demand from over 1 million travelers but also the company’s strategic use of AI to fuel its rapid growth. By embracing the productivity gains made possible by AI, Engine has accelerated its hiring plans and aims to continue growing at this rate throughout the year. To help guide its n
